question: Which Stanford University professor works on Alzheimer's?

paragraphs.title: Thomas C. Sudhof
paragraphs.text:
Introduction
Thomas Christian Sudhof (German pronunciation: ['to:mas 'zy:t,ho:f] i; born December 22, 1955), ForMemRS, is a German-American biochemist known for his study of synaptic transmission. Currently, he is a professor in the school of medicine in the department of molecular and cellular physiology, and by courtesy in neurology, and in psychiatry and behavioral sciences at Stanford University.
